title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 24 march [1868]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 24 March [1868]
text: 1868tuesdayTuesday 24 marchMarchMy dear walterWalteritsit's quite a spell since i have written at any rate it seemesseems so to me i should have wrote and said i had received the letter of fridayFriday but it was such a dreadful storm saturdaySaturday then i thought i would wait till to day i have got the one you sent on fridayFriday or i got it on fridayFriday and one to day both with 5 dollars and the book for maryMary came fridayFriday and the galaxyGalaxy to day with the ballad of sir ball i had forgottonforgotten all about the peicepiece till i see it and then i had to think where i had heard of it and then it came to my mind what piece it was it is signed w i hope nobody will think you wrote it waltWalt)Mary has gone home to day she has had a very satisfactory visit but she thought she must go to day she came last mondayMonday a week ago yesterday) she thinks so much of her daughter minnieMinnie she almost worships her nothing but what they will indulge her in) when marthaMartha was there she seemed to think they were either too close or stingy to or hadenthadn't the means but the means they have whether they have the heart or not to use the means they talk of selling their place and buying one up town further and one more stilishstylish after aunt fanny was buried they had a division of money that she had laid up it was equally divided between Ansel and Noah and georgeGeorge maryMarysMary's son georgeGeorge maryMary said she didentdidn't know how much they had but i shouldentshouldn't wonder if she did as her son georgeGeorge came down with her at any rate i gessguess they will keep what they have got) poor old woman she sshe's been saving up i suppose all her life for who she knows not) i got a letter from mattyMatty yesterday i haventhaven't had one in a long while they have got nicely fixed mattyMatty says and have laid out 1000 dollars that jeffyJeffy is glad they came and they get along nicely mattiMatty said she was going to send a box of things to me she said before she went away she would make me some things when she got settled and amongst the rest she said she would send eddyEddy a present too Edd said he thought matt was the best of all of them) mattyMatty says they was so glad to get your letter that i must tell you you must write often and she will write to you but Jeffy is so busy davisDavis is with them) i sent a small paper of lozenges to the children by davisDavis tied up with a thread matt said hattieHattie kisedkissed the string and put it away cause grammagrandma had sent it good bie walterWalter dear no news from hannaHannah yeti had a letter or package from charley hayCharles Heyde three sheets of foolscap paper and a fool wrote on them Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 24 March [1868]
